title: Could COVID-19 mRNA vaccines also fight cancer?
summary: New study reveals that vaccines developed using mRNA might hold the key to 'off-the-shelf' cancer vaccine.

title: Rodgers, Steelers fall short as Love leads Packers’ win
summary: Aaron Rodgers' former quarterback understudy Jordan Love stars as Green Bay Packers defeat Pittsburgh Steelers.

title: Argentina’s Milei celebrates as early results show election win
summary: Argentina’s President Javier Milei sang to his supporters after early results showed he had won the country’s midterm el

title: Jamaica braces as Hurricane Melissa strengthens offshore
summary: The storm, which threatens to dump up to one metre of rain, is moving at a worryingly slow pace.

title: Austin Reaves scores career-high points as Lakers defeat Kings
summary: Austin Reaves poured in 51 points as the Los Angeles Lakers win against Sacramento without Luka Doncic and Lebron James.

title: Corruption, mismanagement in spotlight as Iran dissolves major private bank
summary: The bank built the largest mall in the world, but also racked up massive debt and gave loans to insiders.

title: Israel committed “genocide” under Netanyahu’s rule
summary: Israeli historian Avi Shlaim says Israel is committing genocide against Palestinians under Netanyahu’s rule.

title: LIVE: Israel denying UNRWA staff entry to Gaza; search for bodies continues
summary: Palestinians returning to their homes in Gaza face danger from unexploded ordnance, with at least 53 people killed.

title: Hong Kong court gives trio lengthy jail terms over bomb plots
summary: Three defendants receive prison terms of up to 18 years over plots in 2019 and 2020.

title: US, China hail progress in trade talks as Trump and Xi set to weigh deal
summary: Officials signal that trade deal is close as Trump and Xi prepare to meet for the first time since 2019.

title: F1 Mexico City: Norris wins GP to take world championship lead from Piastri
summary: McLaren's Lando Norris records a dominant victory to regain the drivers' championship lead for first time since April.

title: Milei’s party wins high-stakes Argentina elections, early results show
summary: Argentinian voters back Javier Milei's radical economic reforms in midterm elections closely watched by the US.

title: Karin Huster: "Gaza, un summum de destruction unique dans l'expérience de beaucoup d'humanitaires"
summary: Deux semaines après la mise en œuvre du cessez-le-feu à Gaza, l'aide humanitaire qui entre dans l'enclave est toujours insuffisante au regard de l'ampleur des besoins et alors qu'une grande partie de la population a été touchée par la famine. Outre les 68 000 morts, près de 170 000 personnes ont été blessées; parmi elles, 15 000 ont besoin d'être évacuées d'urgence selon l'OMS. Témoignage depuis al-Mawasi de Karin Huster, responsable des activités médicales de Médecins sans frontières.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne affirme avoir mené une frappe aérienne contre le Jihad islamique
summary: L'armée israélienne a indiqué, samedi soir, avoir mené une frappe aérienne dans le centre de la bande de Gaza en dépit du cessez-le-feu en vigueur. Elle visait, selon elle, un membre du Jihad islamique.

title: En Israël, Netanyahu va-t-il faire le pari d’une élection anticipée ?
summary: Porté par l’onde de choc de la libération des otages, du cessez-le-feu à Gaza et de la visite triomphale de Donald Trump à Jérusalem, Benjamin Netanyahu va-t-il convoquer des législatives anticipées ? Nombre d’observateurs de la vie politique israélienne penchent en faveur de ce scenario. Le Premier ministre tentera-t-il un ultime coup de poker pour rester au pouvoir ?

title: "Les habitants ne peuvent pas revenir" : Gaza face à la nouvelle "ligne jaune" tracée par Israël
summary: L’armée israélienne a commencé à marquer la "ligne jaune" derrière laquelle elle doit se retirer, conformément au plan de paix signé avec le Hamas. Une ONG juridique israélienne dénonce une "frontière floue" entraînant une "exposition accrue aux tirs" et bloquant l'accès d’une partie de la population aux habitations, terres agricoles et infrastructures civiles.

title: Milices, clans, soutenus ou non par Israël : qui sont les ennemis du Hamas à Gaza ?
summary: Le cessez-le-feu conclu le 10 octobre entre le Hamas et Israël a mis fin à la guerre ouverte, mais pas à la violence à Gaza. Au moins sept factions armées et clans se battent désormais contre le Hamas. Des images témoignent déjà d’affrontements impliquant ces groupes, dont plusieurs sont soupçonnés d'avoir des liens avec Tel-Aviv.

title: Guerre à Gaza : plusieurs pays prêts à participer à une force internationale, affirme Rubio
summary: Depuis Israël, le secrétaire d'État américain Marco Rubio s'est dit "optimiste", vendredi, sur le maintien du cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza. Il affirme que plusieurs pays étaient prêts à participer à une force internationale de stabilisation, conformément au plan de paix pour Gaza déterminé par Donald Trump.

title: Styria, le collectif qui veut faire rire la Syrie… malgré les entraves
summary: “Si on peut rire ensemble, on peut vivre ensemble” : c’est le slogan du Styria Comedy Club. Depuis la chute du régime de Bachar al-Assad, en décembre 2024, ce collectif de stand-up, comptant une trentaine de comédiens, écume les cafés et les salles de spectacle de Syrie. Objectif : rassembler les Syriens autour de l’humour. Si la parole est libérée, il faut néanmoins composer avec les sensibilités de chacun.

title: Marco Rubio en Israël, avertissements américains sur un projet d'annexion de la Cisjordanie occupée
summary: Le secrétaire d'Etat américain Marco Rubio était à son tour en visite en Israël, jeudi, se disant "confiant et positif" sur le maintien de la trêve dans la bande de Gaza. Dans le même temps, Donald Trump a averti qu'Israël perdrait le soutien des États-Unis en cas d'annexion de la Cisjordanie, un projet examiné par la Knesset que le vice-président américain J. D. Vance a qualifié de "très stupide".

title: Cisjordanie occupée: JD Vance s'oppose à son annexion par Israël
summary: En voyage en #Israël, le vice-président américain a rappelé la ferme opposition des Etats-Unis à l’annexion israélienne de la #Cisjordanie occupée.

title: Le Hamas accusé de n’avoir libéré aucune femme otage vivante : pourquoi c’est faux
summary: Alors que les derniers otages israéliens vivant ont été libérés le 13 octobre dernier, certains internautes affirment qu’aucune femme otage n’a survécu à sa captivité. En réalité, la majorité a été libérée lors des précédents échanges ou cessez-le-feu, selon les données du Forum des familles des otages.

title: Syrie : accord de cessez-le-feu entre jihadistes français et forces gouvernementales
summary: Les autorités syriennes et les jihadistes dirigés par le Franco-Sénégalais Oumar Diaby, alias Omar Omsen, ont conclu un accord de cessez-le-feu, selon plusieurs sources concordantes. L'accord concerne un camp dans la région de Harem, à Idleb, près de la frontière turque, que les forces de sécurité syriennes avaient encerclé.

title: La justice française délivre un troisième mandat d'arrêt contre Bachar al-Assad
summary: Deux juges d'instruction ont délivré cet été un mandat d'arrêt contre l'ancien dictateur syrien Bachar al-Assad pour complicité de crimes contre l'humanité et complicité de crimes de guerre. Il s'ajoute aux deux autres mandats d'arrêt déjà délivrés contre lui depuis le début de l'année.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : après l’essai d’un missile à propulsion nucléaire dimanche, Donald Trump dit que Vladimir Poutine « devrait mettre fin à la guerre plutôt que de tester des missiles »
summary: Jugeant l’essai « inapproprié », le président américain a rappelé que « cette guerre qui devait durer une semaine entrera bientôt dans sa quatrième année ». Dimanche, la Russie a testé un missile de croisière à capacité nucléaire et à propulsion nucléaire thermique, nommé « Bourevestnik » et présenté comme « invincible ».

title: Election du maire de New York : Zohran Mamdani, le grand favori qui embarrasse les démocrates
summary: A une semaine du scrutin, le jeune candidat démocrate, autoproclamé socialiste, fait la course en tête des sondages, le fruit d’une campagne habile axée sur le coût de la vie dans la mégapole. Mais son positionnement très à gauche dérange jusque dans son camp et des questions demeurent sur le financement de ses mesures sociales.

title: Législatives en Argentine : Javier Milei remporte une victoire surprise aux élections de mi-mandat
summary: La Libertad Avanza, le parti du président argentin, rassemble plus de 41 % des voix, loin devant l’opposition péroniste. S’il n’obtient pas la majorité au Parlement, le dirigeant ultralibéral jouit désormais de marges de manœuvre accrues dans son entreprise de dérégulation de l’économie.

title: En Israël, des otages lèvent le voile sur leurs conditions de détention
summary: Par le biais de leurs proches, qui témoignent dans la presse israélienne, les derniers otages libérés le 13 octobre par le Hamas relatent leurs peurs, la faim et les bombardements. Mais aussi des moments d’échanges avec leurs geôliers.

title: A Souweïda, dans le sud de la Syrie, Druzes et Bédouins enfermés dans la haine
summary: Plusieurs centaines de membres des deux communautés ont été faits prisonniers durant les affrontements qui les ont opposées, en juillet. Trois mois plus tard, la majorité sont toujours retenus captifs, ce qui envenime le conflit.

title: L’Asie du Sud-Est s’incline devant Donald Trump
summary: A Kuala Lumpur, le président américain a obtenu des pays de la région des droits de douane de 20 % en moyenne sur leurs exportations, des promesses d’achat de produits américains et un engagement préliminaire à ne pas priver les Etats-Unis de leurs terres rares.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : Israël affirme son droit de veto sur une force internationale dans l’enclave palestinienne
summary: « Nous avons (…) clairement indiqué (…) qu’Israël déciderait quelles forces seront inacceptables pour nous », a déclaré dimanche le premier ministre israélien, Benyamin Nétanyahou, opposé à un déploiement de forces de la Turquie, pays qui entretient des liens étroits avec le Hamas.

title: L’industrie européenne prise au piège de la guerre chinoise des terres rares
summary: Automobile, défense, aérospatial, énergie, chimie… toutes les filières technologiques occidentales s’alarment des nouvelles restrictions imposées par Pékin à l’exportation de ces minerais stratégiques.

title: En Belgique, le très prospère trafic de civelles d’« Anguilla anguilla » prisés des Asiatiques
summary: L’espèce sauvage en voie de disparition, dont le prix au marché noir peut monter jusqu’à 9 000 euros le kilo, est la cible de réseaux installés récemment en Europe.

title: En Argentine, le parti de Javier Milei remporte largement les législatives de mi-mandat
summary: La Libertad Avanza a recueilli plus de 40 % des votes au niveau national, selon des résultats officiels portant sur 97 % des bureaux de vote. Le président d’extrême droite a salué un « point de bascule » et promis davantage de réformes.

title: Ouragan Melissa : la Jamaïque menacée par des intempéries « catastrophiques »
summary: L’ouragan a atteint la catégorie 4, avec des vents allant jusqu’à 225 kilomètres-heure. Il devrait passer en catégorie 5, la plus élevée, plus tard dimanche. Les experts redoutent des inondations prolongées et des populations isolées pendant plusieurs jours.

title: Gaza : « L’accord n’en est qu’à ses débuts », déclare le négociateur en chef du Hamas. Retrouvez les informations du 18 au 26 octobre
summary: « Nos armes sont liées à l’occupation [israélienne]. Si l’occupation prend fin, ces armes reviendront à l’Etat. La question des armes fait toujours l’objet de discussions avec les factions [palestiniennes] et les médiateurs, et l’accord n’en est qu’à ses débuts », a déclaré dimanche Khalil Al-Hayya.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Defence officials reportedly told Israeli lawmakers that the international force to be deployed in Gaza is likely to include troops from Pakistan, according to a report in the Ynet news.

  • A US official with the Department of Homeland Security has confirmed that Sami Hamdi, a vocal critic of Israel's war on Gaza, was detained and his visa was revoked. 

  • The UN peacekeeping force in Lebanon says that one of its patrols came under a grenade attack from an Israeli drone, as well as tank fire, near Kfar Kila in southern Lebanon.

  • Two hundred and thirteen patients and their companions left the Gaza Strip on Sunday via the Kerem Shalom crossing in the southeast of the enclave to receive medical treatment abroad, the Palestinian news agency Wafa reported.

  • Lebanon's health ministry said on Sunday that Israeli strikes on the country's south and east had killed three people, despite an ongoing ceasefire deal.

  • The United Nations has reported that Israeli forces have killed at least 40 children in the occupied West Bank this year. 

  • The Red Cross has joined Hamas' armed wing, the Qassam Brigades, to assist the group's search for the bodies of Israeli captives in southern Rafah.

  • Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will determine which countries may contribute troops to a planned international force to be deployed in Gaza as part of a ceasefire under US President Donald Trump's plan.

title: Report: International force to be deployed in Gaza could include troops from Pakistan
summary:
Report: International force to be deployed in Gaza could include troops from Pakistan

Defence officials reportedly told Israeli lawmakers that the international force to be deployed in Gaza is likely to include troops from Pakistan, according to a report in the Ynet news.

Members of the Israeli parliament's Foreign Affairs and Defence Committee were reportedly told during a briefing last week that the international force will be made up of soldiers from Indonesia, Azerbaijan and Pakistan.

title: US Homeland Security confirms detention of UK critic of Israel's war on Gaza
summary:
US Homeland Security confirms detention of UK critic of Israel's war on Gaza

A US official with the Department of Homeland Security has confirmed that Sami Hamdi, a vocal critic of Israel's war on Gaza, was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents and his visa was revoked. 

“Thanks to the work of @Sec_Noem and @SecRubio and the men and women of law enforcement, this individual’s visa was revoked and he is in ICE custody pending removal,” said the department’s assistant secretary for public affairs, Tricia McLaughlin, in a post on X.

title: Israeli drone, tank fire target Unifil patrol in southern Lebanon
summary:
Israeli drone, tank fire target Unifil patrol in southern Lebanon

The UN peacekeeping force in Lebanon (Unifil) says that one of its patrols came under a grenade attack from an Israeli drone, as well as tank fire, near Kfar Kila in southern Lebanon.

The Israeli attacks “are in violation of Security Council Resolution 1701 and Lebanon’s sovereignty, and show disregard for safety and security of the peacekeepers implementing Security Council-mandated tasks in southern Lebanon”, Unifil said in a statement.

title: US rights group condemns arrest of UK critic of Israel’s war on Gaza
summary:
US rights group condemns arrest of UK critic of Israel’s war on Gaza

The Council on American-Islamic Relations (Cair) on Sunday denounced the detention of Sami Hamdi, a British political commentator vocal about Israel’s war on Gaza.

The organisation said Hamdi was detained by immigration officers at San Francisco International Airport on Sunday morning in response to his criticism of the Israeli government during his ongoing speaking tour.

“Everyone should recognise that arresting a British citizen legally visiting the United States because he dared to criticise a foreign nation’s genocide is our government’s latest blatant affront to free speech,” Cair said in a statement.

“Our nation must stop abducting critics of the Israeli government at the behest of unhinged Israel First bigots; this is an Israel First policy, not an America First policy, and it must end,” the group said. Hamdi has not been deported and remains in custody, Cair said.

Earlier this morning, ICE agents abducted British Muslim journalist and political commentator Sami Hamdi at San Francisco Airport, apparently in response to his vocal criticism of the Israeli government during his ongoing speaking tour.

We can confirm that Mr. Hamdi has not been… https://t.co/dfcVGvz6UX

— CAIR National (@CAIRNational) October 26, 2025

title: Over 200 Palestinians leave Gaza for treatment abroad
summary:
Over 200 Palestinians leave Gaza for treatment abroad

Two hundred and thirteen patients and their companions left the Gaza Strip on Sunday via the Kerem Shalom crossing in the southeast of the enclave to receive medical treatment abroad, the Palestinian news agency Wafa reported.

WAFA said crews from the Palestinian Red Crescent Society (Prcs) helped evacuate the patients for treatment in Jordan and several European countries.

The evacuation is part of a series of medical transfers organised by the World Health Organization (WHO).

title: Israeli forces kill one Palestinian in West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces kill one Palestinian in West Bank

A Palestinian was killed by Israeli military at the Meitar checkpoint, south of Hebron, in the occupied West Bank, Al Jazeera reported, citing a medical source.

The Palestinian Red Crescent said two Palestinians were wounded in an attack by Israeli soldiers in the town of Qabatiya, south of Jenin.

According to the UN High Commissioner for Refugees, Israeli forces have targeted Palestinian property more than 2,400 times and displaced at least 3,055 people in the last two years.

title: Lebanon says Israeli strikes kill three
summary:
Lebanon says Israeli strikes kill three

Lebanon's health ministry said on Sunday that Israeli strikes on the country's south and east had killed three people, despite an ongoing ceasefire deal.

Israel claimed it had targeted two members of Hezbollah, without providing any evidence.

Officials said one person had been killed in an "Israeli enemy strike" on a car in Naqoura, in Tyre province, while another strike on a vehicle in Nabi Sheet, in the country's eastern Baalbek region, resulted in another fatality.

Later, the health ministry said a further strike on the town of al-Hafir, also in the Baalbek area, resulted in the death of a Syrian national and an injury to another Syrian.

title: Bob Vylan calls British Airways’ drop of Theroux sponsorship a ‘scare tactic’
summary:
Bob Vylan calls British Airways’ drop of Theroux sponsorship a ‘scare tactic’

Punk singer Bobby Vylan, who called for "death" to the Israeli army, said pro-Israeli lobby groups were trying to silence him after a UK airline dropped its sponsorship of Louis Theroux’s podcast following his interview.

On Saturday, British Airways said it had withdrawn its adverts from the podcast after Vylan’s appearance.

Vylan, the frontman of Bob Vylan, described the move as a “scare tactic” intended to deter others from giving him a platform.

Read more: Bob Vylan calls British Airways’ drop of Theroux sponsorship a ‘scare tactic’

title: Netanyahu says Israel doesn’t seek US approval for Gaza strikes
summary:
Netanyahu says Israel doesn’t seek US approval for Gaza strikes

Israel carries out attacks in Gaza at its own discretion and "does not seek anyone's approval," Haaretz reported Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu saying on Sunday.

Netanyahu said he was rejecting claims that the US government "controls" him and "dictates Israel's security policy.

title: Radiohead's Thom Yorke says he would not perform in Israel
summary:
Radiohead's Thom Yorke says he would not perform in Israel

Radiohead frontman Thom Yorke has said he would not perform in Israel today, eight years after the band defied calls from pro-Palestinian activists by playing a concert in Tel Aviv.

“Absolutely not. I wouldn’t want to be 5,000 miles anywhere near the Netanyahu regime,” he told The Sunday Times Magazine, referring to Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his government.

title: Three former Israeli captives released from hospital
summary:
Three former Israeli captives released from hospital

Israeli media is reporting that three former Israeli captives have been discharged from hospital after spending two weeks in the medical facility. 

The three former captives, Evyatar David, Guy Gilboa-Dalal, and Eitan Mor, were discharged from Beilinson Hospital in the city of Petah Tikva. 

The three former captives will now begin a rehabilitation process with the hospital like other captives held in Gaza, the hospital reported.

Probe is the latest in a series of charges that critics say are designed to sideline the only candidate believed capable of defeating President Erdogan in an election

PM tried hard to prevent the preliminary approval of two West Bank annexation bills, knowing he risked irritating the Trump administration, but simply couldn't muster the leverage

title: In photos: Sepahan vs. Peykan in Iran Pro League
summary: The match between Sepahan and Peykan football teams, part of the 8th week of Iran’s Pro League, was held on October 26, 2025, at Naghsh-e-Jahan Stadium, in Isfahan, central Iran, and ended with a 1-0 victory for Sepahan.

title: Iran’s envoy emphasizes need for stronger ties with Russia: Lawmaker
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran's ambassador to Russia says Moscow and Tehran are serious about strengthening strategic partnership and enhancing relations in all fields, according to a senior lawmaker.

title: Iranian women’s rugby team finish as runners-up at 2025 Asian Championship
summary: Tehran, IRNA – In a historic achievement for Iranian sports, the national women’s rugby team have claimed the runner-up title at the 2025 Asian Rugby Championship held in Muscat, Oman, marking Iran’s best-ever finish in the competition.

title: Iranian deputy foreign minister meets with Cuban, Armenian officials
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s Deputy Foreign Minister Vahid Jalalzadeh has held meetings with Cuban Justice Minister Oscar Manuel Silveira Martínez and Armenian Deputy Foreign Minister Mnatsakan Safaryan on the sidelines of the United Nations Convention against Cybercrime in Hanoi.

title: Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital spox says ceasefire violations worsen patients’ conditions
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Spokesperson for Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital Khalil al-Daqran said that the Israeli occupiers’ violation of the ceasefire has worsened the conditions of patients.

title: Iran: Unilateral coercive measures hinder international cooperation in combating crime
Hezbollah Chief: Supporting Gaza was the right move; Ayatollah Khamenei fully supported the resistance
Iran wins nine medals in Muay Thai contests at Manama Asian Youth Games
Slice of Iranian history at Niavaran Palace
summary: Tehran, IRNA— An exhibition titled Taste of the Museum serves up a slice of Iranian history and narrates cultural identity at Niavaran Palace in Tehran.

title: Deputy FM visits Afghanistan for talks on water, border, and legal issues
summary: Gharibabadi said his trip to Kabul is part of Iran’s regional policy and in line with expanding bilateral cooperation.

title: UNICEF says Gaza ceasefire ‘vital chance’ for 1 million children in need
Hamas urges international action as Israel keeps violating ceasefire
summary: Hamas says it is in constant contact with the mediators to inform them of Israeli violations of the Gaza ceasefire deal.

title: Trump reacts to Russia's nuclear Burevestnik missile test
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – Russia and the United States do not play games with each other, US President Donald Trump said, commenting on the successful testing of Russia's nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile.

title: Iran to Host ECO Ministerial Meeting
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – After a 15-year hiatus, Iran is set to host a meeting of interior ministers of the Economic Cooperation Organization (ECO) in Tehran, reflecting the government’s policy of closer cooperation with neighboring countries.

title: At least 3 killed in new Israeli strikes across Lebanon
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – At least three people have been killed as a result of Israeli strikes in southern and eastern Lebanon, according to the country’s Ministry of Public Health, despite a ceasefire agreement that took effect almost a year ago.

title: Iran, Russia to sign key deal on railway construction
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – Iran’s Minister of Roads and Urban Development Farzaneh Sadeq says Iran and Russia are to sign a long-anticipated agreement on the construction of the Rasht-Astara railway.

title: VIDEO: Taal Volcano erupts three times in Philippines
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – Taal Volcano in the Philippines reportedly erupted three times on Sunday, sending huge ash plumes into the sky. According to reports, authorities have raised the alert level and warned people to stay away from danger zones.

title: Iranian nurses, beating heart of country's health system
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – Iran's National Nurse Day coincides with the birth anniversary of one of the most revered ladies for Shia Muslims, Hazrat Zeinab (SA), the daughter of Imam Ali (PBUH).

title: Front pages of Iran’s English dailies on October 27
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran’s English language dailies on Monday, October 27.

title: US fighter jet, helicopter crash after mission in Yemen
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – The US Navy has lost a fighter jet and a helicopter based off the aircraft carrier USS Nimitz as both crashed into the South China Sea in separate incidents within 30 minutes of each other on Sunday afternoon.

title: Iran pushing for more prominent role for gas exporting group
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – Iran says it is trying to elevate the position of the Gas Exporting Countries Forum (GECF) in international energy equations.

title: Hamas reaffirms Gaza ceasefire
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 27 (MNA) – A senior Hamas official underscored the movement’s unwavering commitment to upholding the ceasefire in Gaza, stressing that Palestinians seek nothing less than their internationally recognized right to an independent state.

title: Hezbollah chief Qassem speaks to media
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 26 (MNA) – Sheikh Naim Qassem held a detailed interview with the media tonight on the occasion of the first anniversary of his appointment as Hezbollah’s Secretary-General.

title: Trump meets Brazil’s Lula at ASEAN summit
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 26 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump and Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva have held what Brazil described as a constructive meeting on the sidelines of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) Summit in Malaysia.

title: پلیس: ۶۰ هزار نخ سیگار قاچاق در شهرقدس کشف شد
summary: قدس- فرمانده انتظامی شهرقدس از کشف ۶۰ هزار نخ سیگار و یک‌هزار بسته تنباکوی خارجی قاچاق به ارزش ۶ میلیارد ریال خبر داد.

title: افقی تازه در درمان زخم‌های شدید قرنیه با استفاده از سلول‌های بنیادی
summary: گروهی از محققان دانشگاه تهران، موفق به ارائه روش نوین و ترکیبی، برای ترمیم زخم‌های شدید قرنیه شده‌اند که بر پایه استفاده هوشمندانه از سلول‌های بنیادی و پانسمان‌های بیولوژیک استوار است.

title: کاهش رتبه اعتباری فرانسه به خاطر چند پارگی سیاسی
summary: موسسه بین المللی رتبه‌بندی مودیز اعلام کرد که چند پارگی سیاسی به اقتصاد فرانسه آسیب زده و موجب شده تا رتبه اعتباری این کشور کاهش یابد.

title: الزام انصراف قطعی پیش از ثبت‌نام کنکور ۱۴۰۵ برای دانشجویان علوم پزشکی
summary: مرکز خدمات آموزشی وزارت بهداشت بر ضرورت انصراف از تحصیلی دانشجویان پیش از ثبت‌نام کنکور ۱۴۰۵ تاکید کرد.

title: فرزانه صادق: نقش زنان در پیشبرد اهداف راه و شهرسازی حیاتی است
summary: ساری - وزیر راه و شهرسازی ضمن تبریک روز پرستار گفت: نقش زنان در پیشبرد اهداف وزارتخانه حیاتی است.

title: میرغضنفری: اصناف در پویایی اقتصاد نقش محوری دارد
summary: رشت-فرماندار رشت رشت با تأکید بر نقش محوری اصناف در پویایی اقتصاد گفت: دولت وظیفه دارد با رویکردی تسهیل‌گرانه در کنار فعالان صنفی قرار گرفته تا تعادل در بازار و آرامش در جامعه حفظ شود.
